inn1.comm: full and swinging away from off stump, Moor, drawn forward, gets a thick edge down to third man
beaten outside off. This one nips away from good length outside off, Chibhabha is squared up as the ball whizzes past the edge
hops across and punches a short of length delivery to mid-on
full and shapes away a touch from off stump, Chibhabha hangs back and bunts it to cover

on the shorter side and he's crunched that between cover and point. Sloppy from Axar, who pushes the ball further away as he tries to pull it back in. Wouldn't have been able to save the third anyway, so no damage done

half-drive but he's got that up and over the infield. Not where he wanted, but it doesn't matter. Squeezes it over Axar again at backward point, opened the bat face but checked his shot which meant he didn't get enough power behind it. Steady first over

you beauuuuuuuuty!  I have no idea why he wasn't given out. Chibhabha is extremely fortunate to survive.  Umpire Russell Tiffin gets it wrong. Banana swing back in, hits him flush on the pad on middle stump. Looks like the umpire thought it was sliding down leg
bowls it short and down the leg side, some exercise for the umpire
stays inside the crease and defends
ball deflects off the thigh pad to short fine leg, they take a run off the deflection
gets forward and drives it to short cover
stifled appeal for caught behind as the ball swings back in to middle and leg, the ball clipped the pad on the way through to Dhoni

Sran finally gets his man. This one was full and swinging back in again, Moor is stuck on the crease as he looks to work it across the line and is trapped plumb in front of middle. This time umpire Tiffin is certain that it would have hit the stumps. Reward for Sran's persistence
full outside off, looks to drive but played outside the line, ball rolls back down the pitch off the inside edge
pushed to the leg side, calls wait almost immediately as midwicket stops the ball
gets the radar wrong as he looks to bring the ball back in to the right hander, slips it down leg
stays back and punches that into the gap between cover and cover point, the outfield seems a bit heavy
shapes away from off stump, excellent length again. Invites the batsman to drive, Chibhabha shows the full face of the bat and drives it to mid-off
gets it to shape away from length outside off, he plays inside the line, squared up a touch as the ball shaves past the edge
call of wait again as he bunts a full ball to mid-off
swings back in to middle and leg, Masakadza plays it wide of midwicket to get off the mark
not sure why he'd try to bang the ball in short at 132 clicks when he's swinging the ball beautifully. Slips the short ball down leg as the batsman hops across to nurdle it fine

late on the stroke again. The ball is bowled full, swings back in to middle but he was a couple of paces down the pitch to nullify the swing. He falls over as he looks to flick. Stifled appeal again, but this was an easier decision for the umpire.
floats it across the batsman who watches it through to MS Dhoni

this time, perhaps he tried to bowl the awayswinger. Or maybe he was thrown off gear by the batsman's early movement. This one's on the seventh stump outside off. Slip fielder could have collected the ball, really
much, much better. This one's a lot straighter on middle, the batsman looks to walk across to flick, square leg comes into play

missed the stumps by a whisker, and I'm not exaggerating.  Chibhabha gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he looks to flick the full ball on middle across the line, the ball nearly deflected onto the off stump. Couple of millimetres at best
gets half forward and bunts the inswinging delivery to the off side
lunges forward and covers the line by defending it to cover with the full face of the bat
gets forward and a touch across as he plays it back down the pitch
punched to cover, a misfield by Ambati Rayudu gives them the single. The half-stop deflected the ball towards mid-off
full outside off,  Chibhabha is happy to stay back inside the crease as he shoulders arms
looks to drive, this one holds its line, and so it takes the inside edge to mid-on
tucked wide of midwicket for an easy single to keep strike
looks to force that through the off side, it was short alright but there wasn't much width, the ball scoots low to Dhoni as well. Wonder if it hit a crack and kept low.
the ball lands short of KL Rahul at leg slip off the deflection. He looked to tuck it behind square but was cramped for room
gets some bat on it this time, wide of Rahul, Dhawal stops that one at fine leg
width and should have been put away, Masakadza will be disappointed. There was no gully, and it was sitting up nicely for him to cut. Missed.
punched to mid-off
pushed off the backfoot to Rayudu at cover, didn't get the kind of power on that attempted punch
squared up by the full awayswinger. This one lands outside off, Masakadza's bat comes down at an angle as he looks to work it towards the onside. Beaten!
covers the line of that away swinger this time as he bunts it to cover
full on middle from wide of the crease, flicked across the line to Chahal at mid-on
crunched but can't find the gap, straight to Jadhav at mid-off

that's a big appeal but was it sliding down leg? Masakadza walks across to flick but misses and is hit on the pad. Umpire said not out immediately. Looks like the ball swung back in a little too much. Ian Gould was the umpire in question
hangs back and pats it to cover off the backfoot
some zip off the pitch from the length area on middle, nips back in, Chibhabha pushes outside the line and gets a thick inside edge onto his pad
outstanding work by Rayudu at mid-off. A full-length dive to his right to that crunching drive saves a certain boundary
nothing shot, really. Length delivery that nips back in from off stump, he looks to slap it across the line with a horizontal bat, but was in no position to do so
finally gets it right. Too short, he controlled that pull well as he played it to the right of the square leg umpire. Picking the length early was the key, which Masakadza did
he's on the floor! Oh, dear. I was briefly reminded of Mustafizur's delivery to Dre Russ in the IPL. Full and tails back in to hit him flush on the toe. The ball would have missed leg stump though.
shows the full face of the bat and punches down the ground towards mid-off where Rayudu misfields to deflect the ball towards the boundary. He then has to recover and the hurl the throw from the deep
first bad ball he's bowled down leg, and has been punished. Easy pick up shot for Masakadza. Lofted over midwicket, couple of bounces into the boundary
gets half forward and turns it with his wrists to mid-on
walks across the stumps and bunts the length ball to point

some reward, finally. Kept shaping the ball away but all he saw was the batsman either being squared up or leave the ball. This time, the ball is just around the off stump, Masakadza simply had no option but to play at it, and it was a very feeble push as the ball took the edge through to Dhoni, who had to move forward to take the catch. Signs of the surface being two-paced? I'm not sure, but Masakadza's misery is over. Excellent from Dhawal, Dhoni's decision to give him a fifth over has been justified.
shapes back into middle, he shows the full face to defend it back down the pitch
floats it full and across the batsman who is happy to let that go
hustles him for pace again. This one nearly slipped through the gap between bat and pad. Saved by an inside edge, else that inswing was headed toward the base of leg stump
late on the drive. Once again, the ball shapes back in from off stump, somehow manages to jam his bat down on time to keep that out
whips the back of length delivery on middle into the gap between square leg and mid-on
floats a short of length delivery across Chibhabha, who hangs his bat out without any conviction, zips through to Dhoni
whipped, but straight to Jadhav at square leg
gets a thick inside edge on the drive to midwicket
oversteps in his quest for pace, perhaps. Full ball pushed to mid-on.  Can Ervine capitalise on the free-hit?
No, he can't. This is a yorker-length delivery outside off, fails to get his bat down on time to squeeze that behind point
length ball that pitches on leg and holds its line, the ball deflects off the thigh pad to the off side and they stral a single
hops onto the backfoot and punches the short ball to cover
floats a full ball on off stump from wide of the crease, bunted back down the pitch with a straight bat
cuts back in a touch, he plays outside the line slightly and gets the inner half of the bat on the push that rolls back to the bowler
sliding down leg, he looks to help it to fine leg, but is late on the stroke. Bumrah isn't convinced, he though there was some thigh pad on it
this one's too short and wide, lucky to get away with that wide line. The batsman looked to slap that over point, but missed.
wonder if he's tiring a bit. This one's a nothing ball, slides it down leg, Dhoni moves low to his right to collect that
gets a thick inside edge to midwicket as they get across for the single
nips back into middle and leg from the length area, worked to square leg
shapes for the pull but the ball rushes onto him, takes the top half of the bat and rolls slowly down to fine leg

beaten on the drive. That's a lovely delivery, full and swinging away from outside off. There was no cover fielder, so the invitation was there, but he missed. Top stuff from Sran, has been impressive all morning
looks to bowl a yorker but slips in a low full toss, bunted down the ground past mid-on, not off the middle though, the bat face turned in his hand as he made contact
flat-bats the pull over the bowler's head, couple of bounces into the straight boundary. This one was short, a tired delivery, and Ervine muscled that one well. Welcome boundary
full on middle from around the stumps, driven down to long-off
beats the batsman with a slider that pitches outside off and holds its line
gets across the stumps and paddles it to fine leg
slower through the air, lands it on middle, he makes some room and eases it to short third man
gets across the stumps and works it wide of square leg
nicely tossed up this time, gets some drift on that from wide of the crease, Ervine looks to work it past midwicket but the late swerve means he's beaten

the off stump has been flattened! This one was full from wide of the crease, Chibhabha planted his foot forward but was late on the defensive shot as the ball sneaks past the inside edge to deflect onto the stumps off the pad. The late inswing did him in. Zimbabwe in trouble.
gets a thick inside edge towards Axar as he defends the short ball bowled at an angle from wide of the crease
squared up as the ball rolls off the edge towards point
gets an inside edge onto his right thigh as he pushes outside the line, looked faster than 133.3 clicks that was registered by the speed gun
gets half-forward and bunts it to the off side
slips it in full from wide of the crease, defended back down the pitch
paddled to fine leg, it was pushed through quicker
slides one into middle from around the stumps, he gets a good stride forward and defends
pushed through quicker on middle, driven to cover
slower through the air this time, lands it on middle, hint of turn, pushed to cover again
drops it with soft hands towards cover point and sets off for a quick single
lunges forward to smother the spin
angles a length ball on off stump, the ball holds its line instead of coming back in with the angle, Sibanda has the line well covered as he defends
fuller ball on off stump, the ball took off awkwardly to hit him on high on the bat as he defended that one
back of length delivery angling into middle and leg, he looks to whip it behind square but is late on the shot. Hit on the rib
poor ball and is lucky to get away, full toss down leg, but it was the slower one, all he needed to do was get some bat on it, Sibanda got some pad instead as the ball deflects towards fine leg
once again, a good amount of zip from the back of length area on leg stump. Ervine is hit on the thigh pad as he looks to work it past square leg
gets half-forward and bunts it back down the pitch
in-drifter on off stump from around the stumps, he gets an inside edge to square leg as he stabs forward
fetches the fine paddle from outside off, gets a top edge but there's no one around the corner
tossed up outside off stump, tapped wide of cover for an easy single
this one's quicker on middle, he's behind the line perfectly as he defends
skids onto middle, he's hurried into the punch as he plays it to midwicket fielder Karun Nair, who deflects it to Axar, but they steal the run
gets forward and works it with the spin to midwicket

Rahul's dropped a sitter at second slip.  The length ball slated across to square him up as he pushed hard at the ball, Rahul went at it with hard hands and put it down. Perhaps got it high on the palm. Poor technique too. His legs were too close and that somewhat restricted his movement
floats a length ball across, but oversteps.  Free-hit time
oh, dear. He's got it completely wrong. This one was too full but well on the seventh stump down leg, even a diving Dhoni can't get any glove on that. Five wides, and the free hit will stay

comedy of errors there. Ervine looks to swing that across the line, but gets a top edge towards fine leg, Barinder Sran coming in from the deep keeps his eye on the swirler, but was in no position whatsoever to catch that. Called for it, but was miles away from the ball. In the end, he embarrassingly saw the ball bursts through his fingers. Dhoni sure isn't pleased with that. Didn't matter though, as the free-hit stayed
slides this one across him, through to the keeper
squared up and is well and truly beaten by the away-swinger. Beautiful bowling this
tucked to fine leg for an easy single. An eventful over
tossed up on middle, driven with the spin to long-on
too full outside off, squeezed behind point for an easy single
worked with the spin behind square on the leg side for an easy single
gets some drift into middle, gives it a lot of revs, the batsman gets an inside edge as he looks to push it to the off side
driven past the bowler to long-off, once again it was gently tossed up
hammered down the ground, Chahal dives to his left to stop that, the deflection rolls to mid-off
half-volley but he can't capitaise. Driven straight to Rayudu at mid-off

there's the wicket, and you have to say lack of temperament has resulted in that. It was short and wide, there to play the cut, but Sibanda was undone by the extra bounce as the thick edge is pouched by Dhoni. Sibanda made a mistake of going under the ball rather than getting on top of the bounce.
squared up as he stays inside the crease to defend, somehow manages to get some bat on it
gets across and taps it to short midwicket
gets forward and opens the face of the bat slightly to ease that past the cover fielder and get off the mark
stays inside the crease to negotiate that short of length delivery on middle to the off side with soft hands
give it good flight, lands it on middle, was a touch too full and that allowed him to drive it along the ground to long-on
looks to hammer it across the line, couldn't get underneath the ball, the flat hit is well stopped by the bowler
drilled down the ground even though he didn't get to the pitch of the tossed up delivery on off stump, wasn't far away from Chahal
slows it down nicely again, Raza is drawn forward but can't get to the pitch of the ball, defends
lunges forward and pats it with soft hands
gets the ball to break away from off stump, this one had a flatter trajectory, well blocked by the batsman

the batsman is rubbing his thighs. Ufff, that must hurt. Ervine is half-forward as he looks to defend to the off side, but the ball pitches on leg stump and holds its line to hit him high on the left thigh
stays on the back foot to defend, Bumrah gets some lift on it again to catch the top half of the bat, awkwardly defended
squared up by one that cuts away from middle and off. The ball zipped past the outside edge, Ervine was clearly late on the defensive shot
hustled for pace, he hops back and bunts it with soft hands to the off side
this one's floated down leg, worked behind square on the leg side
fuller delivery that grips the surface and hits him high on the bat, Raza took the bottom hand off the grip as he made contact
cheeky, paddled from outside off towards fine leg, he was playing it with the angle so it was risk-free
reads the wrong'un off the hand, lunges forward and defends
the short ball skids onto him from middle, punched back past the bowler, who swiftly moves to his left to stop that
driven across the line to long-on, was drifting into middle from wide of the crease
excellent stop off his own bowling, it was hit reasonably hard back down the ground. He moved to his left and then dived to make the stop
the batsman's made to stretch a long way to smother the spin, excellent variations in pace
quicker one on middle, punched past Chahal at mid-on
quicker one that spins back in from off stump, pushed to point
fires one on leg stump, the ball slides back in past the stumps, good stop by Dhoni
pushed off the backfoot, but stopped by Chahal at cover, saved a couple of runs
cramps him for room by angling it back into the stumps, pushed to cover again
goes wide of the crease this time to toss it up an land one on middle, worked to midwicket

poor delivery, but he's got a wicket against the run of play. Ervine was looking for a release shot. In all fairness this was a delivery to be hit. It was short on middle, he shaped to pull and made good contact, but he was hitting it towards the longer boundary. Faiz Fazal, the substitute fielder, had to contend with the sun in his eyes, but positioned himself well by moving backwards and to his left, and made the catch look easier than it was. The ball was struck hard but he had no doubts whatsoever with his catching technique. Axar has a sheepish smile on his face, heart of hearts, he knew that didn't really deserve a wicket.
pushes outside the line of the ball, gets an inside edge to short fine
the leading edge nearly lobbed back to the bowler
this one was pushed through quicker, it was the googly as well, Chigu reads it off the hand and covers the line before defending
forces one off the backfoot to cover
steps out but realises it can't get to the pitch, the ball breaks away sharply to square him up, somehow adjusts and defends
stretches forward to ease it back to the bowler. Superb over
drifts one into middle from wide of the crease from around the stumps, driven to sweeper cover
gets a thick inside-edge to mid-on as he looks to drive
pushed back with the spin to the bowler
gets half-forward and pats it with soft hands. Pressure building
too full, squeezed to deep cover, off the mark off his 10th delivery
works it with the angle to Chahal at midwicket
stays inside the crease, makes room and eases it to deep point
touch short again, crunched to deep cover
he's looking to go over the top. Steps out again but recovers quickly to chop that to the off side
completely foxed by the wrong'un that beats him in flight and skids back in to beat the inside edge, Dhoni stays low to collect that
rooted to the crease as he bunts the quicker one to cover
loopy delivery that spins away from outside off, Chigu shoulders arms, once again wouldn't have got to the pitch of the ball.
welcome boundary! This one was in the slot to drive, but all he managed was a thick outside edge that raced past short third man
drifting into middle from round the stumps, worked with the angle to short mid-on

played for the turn but this one went straight on to hit him on the pad. Umpire Ian Gould reckons he was struck outside the line of the stumps. 50-50 call  On second thoughts, it looked like more than half the ball was inside the line
gets forward and defends
pushed through on middle, he gets onto the backfoot to tap that back down the pitch
stretches forward and defends it with soft hands to short cover
good work by Nair, it was driven well but he moved to his left to stop it at cover
slower through the air, lands it on off stump, he stretches forward to drop

squared up as he looks to work it across the line, gets an outside edge that lands short of Rahul at slip and races away into the third man boundary. Rahul didn't stay low, could have done better to make an attempt to stop that
punched past cover for an easy single
drifting into middle, hint of turn as it was pushed through quicker, defended with soft hands
the googly this time, shapes to cut but didn't have room, still manages to hit it but straight to point
quicker one on middle, he's late on the defensive shot, is hit high on the bat
pushed back to the bowler
looks to cut but the ball kept coming back in, somehow managed to squeeze that behind point. Would have been trapped plumb in front had he missed that
gets half-forward and defends
opens the bat face and defends it to Karun coming in from extra cover
worked to midwicket. Phew, my fingers are hurting. He's bowled that over in 72 seconds
tell you what, Chahal will bowl much worse on other days and finish with more wickets. Sharp turn again, he looks to work it across the line but gets a leading edge that flies wide of Rahul at slip
rocks back and punches it to sweeper cover
pushed to Rayudu at point
plays the short one towards Dhawal at deep point
slower through the air, invites the batsman to hit him over the top, but Chigu is happy to simply smother the spin
looks to work it across the line, the ball lobs in the air off the leading edge but lands short of short fine leg

he's picked the bones out of that one. Short ball, and he welcomes him back with an imperious pull. One bounce into the midwicket boundary. It was almost as if he was waiting for the shot. Was waiting inside the crease and made solid contact
length ball on off, defended to point
worked with the angle to deep midwicket
this one tails back in. Hint of reverse, perhaps? Chigu does well to have his bat close to the pad as he defends that one to the off side
punched off the backfoot to deep cover
gets across and pulls one down to fine leg, didn't get hold of it completely though
slider on middle and leg, late on the whip, ball deflect off the thigh pad to short fine leg
gets forward and dabs it to short midwicket
opens the face of the bat and steers it to point, Rahul moves well to his right to cut the single
this one keeps a touch low on middle, Raza was behind the line as he punched it back to the bowler
waits for the turn and punches it back to the bowler
hint of grip and turn, check-driven to cover
crunched to Sran at deep point. Sweet sound as ball made contact with the bat
beaten, but he wasn't far away from an edge. This one was too full for Raza to cut
drops it towards cover for a quick single, Chahal was off balance as he moved to his left to stop the ball
banged in short outside off, but gets away with it. Russell Tiffin deems it a legal delivery. He really was flirting with the wide line!
square driven on the up, Sran is on the ball almost immediately at deep point
looks to shuffle across and whip it across the line, but the ball nips away late to get the leading edge and roll towards the off side
driven with the spin to long-off
this one's pushed through quicker, lands it on middle, played back to the bowler
cramped for room as he shapes to cut, somehow gets some bat towards short cover as they scamper through for a quick single
tossed up outside off, he hammers the drive and pierces the gap, wide long-off fielder does well to get around to stop that. Manish Pandey dived over the ball at cover
gets forward and covers the line of that arm ball as he defends
lobs off the inside edge to the leg side, was briefly in the air, Dhoni moved to his left but couldn't have really got to the ball
starts off with a slow off-cutter on the stumps, he watchfully defends to the off side
too full and on the pads, flicked straight to Pandey at midwicket
cuts well, but Rahul dives to his right to stop that. Was airborne when he stopped the ball, saved two runs for the side, third man was fine
this time, he places it between point and third man, Rahul had to move to his left this time, and dived over the bal even though he anticipated the ball well
drilled to sweeper cover, lucky to get away with that one, was too full and right in the slot for the big hit
turned behind square on the leg side, Jadhav does well to hare in from the boundary to keep it down to a single
punched to midwicket
gets the inner half of the bat as he stabs to defend
poor fielding by Manish Pandey at cover, a misfield allows the single. He didn't stay low to stop that rocket hit
steps out but is deceived in flight, has to quickly adjust to get behind the line and block
in-drifter on middle, he gets half-forward and bunts it with soft hands
punched past the bowler to long-on
slants a full delivery across the batsman, who is beaten as he looks to open the face and steer it behind square on the off side
chops a full delivery angling away, to the off side.

he's played on! This was a friendly full delivery on off stump, Raza went hard at that but his head was all over the place, wasn't looking down on the ball as he made contact and only managed a thick inside edge that cannoned into the stumps.
the full delivery tails away from outside off this time, left alone
stays inside the crease and fends that short ball with soft hands
wayward delivery which he bowls every now and then. This one was way too full outside off, Dhoni was standing wider than he normally would, and so it was a regulation take
defended off the backfoot with soft hands
good work by Axar, diving to his left at midwicket to stop that flick
driven with the spin to long off
gets forward and turns the quicker one on the stumps to the leg side
pushes the googly through quicker on off stump, Mutumbami defends
breaks back in, but it's slow turn. Allows Mutumbami time to chop it
fetches the low full toss from outside off, flicked to deep midwicket
cuts and misses. It was the zip that did him in, was late on the shot again
squared up as he defends the length ball outside off to the off side
that to me is the shot of the day! Stood tall, got on top of the bounce, opened the face of the bat at the last moment to flay it over the infield, into the point boundary at the rate of knots
skids back in from wide of the crease, defended to square leg
play and a miss. Too close for him to try and dab that down to third man
beaten on the drive. This one moves away after pitching, he went for a crunching cover drive but was late on the shot
worked wide of midwicket, Axar has a shy at the bowler's end but Chigumbura was easily in
looks to slog across the line, drags the inside edge to short fine leg
drifts in and spins away from middle, he turned the bat face early, ball lobs off the leading edge, just short of point
stays back and punches the short'ish delivery on middle to deep midwicket
drills the low full toss to long-on
cramped for room as he looks to cut a delivery that turns sharply from off stump, played to cover
floats it foo full on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket where Sran makes a royal mess of that again, ran in a little too early and ended up misfielding to concede an extra run
wrists it wide of square leg
looks to flick, the ball swerves away in the air as Mutumbami ends up slicing it over cover instead
nudged behind square on the leg side for an easy single

has he gloved that? This was short, but he was hurried into the pull, there was a big noise as it went past the batsman. Dhoni was confident and went up in an appeal straightaway, but replays confirm the ball clipped the helmet. Good decision, Russell Tiffin
pushed towards long-on for an easy single
floats a length ball on middle, the ball jags away a touch, Mutumbami pushes outside the line but manages to get an inside edge that rolls past square leg
back-of-the-hand slower delivery which he disguises so swell, it was too slow for Chigumbura, who waited and waited before he slapped it to deep point
gets behind the line of that length ball and defends
this one hurries onto him from the good length area on middle, hurries his bat down to defend that towards midwicket
shot, boy! This one's crashed on the up past the bowler. Long-off was a tad wide, and had no chance even though he was a few metres away from the ball.

attempts to slap that over long-off, but hit it wider than he intended, one bounce to Kedar Jadhav at long-off. He went flat-batted but couldn't generate too much power behind that one, maybe because he didn't have the kind of pace he was looking for on that one
steps out and works it across the line to deep midwicket
makes some room, opens the off side up as he lofts it over the infield to deep cover

if anyone deserved a wicket, it was Chahal. He has a big smile on his face as KL Rahul completes a regulation catch at long-off. This was generously tossed up outside off, Mutumbami looked to clear the ropes but only managed to hit it off the toe end of the bat. Rahul only had to move a couple of paces to his left to complete the catch. Chahal is off the mark in international cricket.
driven back to the bowler
leans forward and eases it to sweeper cover
this one was pushed through quicker, it was a flipper which Chigumbura defended off the backfoot. He was deep inside the crease when he made contact
drops it into the off side gently for a quick single
drawn forward by an away swinger, the thick edge flies to third man
width on offer, crunched to Axar at deep point

pulled, and pulled well. He's managed to pick the gap between deep square and long-on. Not much pace to hurry the batsman and Dhawal has been punished. Intent from the captain straightaway and he has been rewarded
firm drive, but straight to extra cover
play and a miss. Looks to drive on the up, but pulled out of the stroke at the last moment
slips in an excellent yorker on middle, squeezed to midwicket. Was nearly a toe-crusher
full toss on middle, worked to deep square leg, another scoring opportunity missed.
slower delivery on middle and off, he gets a thick inside edge towards deep square, Cremer slipped as he turned for the second
another slow off-cutter on the stumps, he taps it into the off side and sets off for a quick single, Bumrah tried to flick an underarm throw but didn't collect it cleanly
another outstanding yorker he spears at an angle from wide of the crease, Cremer his bat down in time to keep that out

chance of a run-out at the non-striker's end had Rahul hit the stumps from mid-off, but he missed. He toe-ended an attempted lofted hit and ran diagonally across the stumps. Poor running technique, hope Ntini has made note
swing and a miss. This one wasn't a half-volley by any means, more at length. He went at it a little too early.
pushed wide of Karun Nair at cover for a quick single
mistimes a high full toss, long-on and long-off converge. It was a juicy full toss which he could have hit anywhere, hit the toe-end
squeezed to long-off

gave away his intentions of walking across to scoop too early, and has missed a straight one. Dhawal floated it at length on middle, and once Cremer hit, there was little hope of surviving. He was completely blinded as he looked to help it over short fine, and missed it altogether.
leg-cutter on that occasion, he looked to flay that across the line without any feet movement, beaten
top effort by Chahal at cover. It was full on middle, Chigu drilled that. Thought the momentum would have taken Chahal along with it
makes some room and bunts it to point, Pandey has a shy at the stumps at the bowler's end but misses the mark by some distance
slower delivery outside off, he backed away to go over cover but swung way too early

another one bites the dust, but Bumrah has overstepped. Chigumbura was looking to hit towards the longest boundary again, and has fallen. The swing didn't connect off the middle by any means and Axar judged it well at deep midwicket. All to no avail.  Free-hit coming up.  Opportunity for Chigumbura to unleash a few big hits. It needs one replay to confirm that he had overstepped by a long, long way.
squeezed back down the ground to long-on
slower one on the stumps, turned wide of the bowler, towards mid-on
attempts to bowl that at the base of middle and succeeds, Chigumbura just manages to keep that out
not for the first time has Sran bowled one full and wide on the seventh stump. Even Joel Garner couldn't have got a bat on that

gets a thick edge down to third man, Rayudu lobs a throw to Dhoni. Chigumbura wanted to get back on strike, but there was hesitation from his partner who turned back finally. Dhoni's throw hit the stumps at the striker's end but Chatara was saved by a desperate dive in the end
back-of-the-hand slower one outside off, pushed to point
flay and a miss. Looked to play that on the up over point, but was too early into the stroke. Was through with the swing when ball passed the bat
beaten by the slower one, this was a touch inside the line, and so he escapes. Well-disguised
gets a bottom edge off an attempted cut down to third man
tennis ball bounce on that occasion, Chigumbura could have had a cup of coffee before meeting that slower bouncer. In the end, pulls it over square leg and manages to pinch a second
backs away to leg, Bumrah follows him with a length ball, played towards deep square leg
spongy bounce on the slower one again, he looked to pull but was beaten by the change in pace

'you miss and I hit' stuff. Length ball on middle from wide of the crease, Chigumbura shaped to pull but the ball cut back in to beat the inside edge and hit leg stump. Industrious knock, but couldn't get the impetus
drops it with soft hands into the off side for a quick single

excellent calling from Rayudu. He ensured he called early to get underneath that mistimed skier, but it wasn't easy as he was looking into the sun while running in from mid-on. But ensured he kept his eyes on the ball, made the late adjustment by moving back a touch to complete the catch. Best bowling figures for Bumrah

inn2.comm: starts off with a gentle short and wide delivery outside off, Rahul hops back and steers it behind point to get off the mark
floats a full ball on off stump from wide of the crease, Nair's foot is glued to the crease as he defends with an open face of the bat to point
shapes away from a touch ahead of the good length area on off stump, Nair gets a good stride forward and plays it back to the bowler
off the mark with a neat little flick past midwicket. Looks for some late swing but ends up floating it into the pads, tucked away nicely. First international runs for Nair
full and moving away from outside off, Nair shoulders arms
once again a little too straight, Nair covers the swing and works it past midwicket
floats a length ball on off stump, Nair gets half-forward and bunts it firmly to backward point
driven on the up, but falls just short of cover point. Struck well, but it was almost as if he didn't realise there was a fielder there to cut that off
this one nips back into middle from back of length area outside off, the ball gets a little big on Nair as he defends it with soft hands
firm push off the backfoot to that short of length delivery on middle. He isn't the tallest of batsman, but showed he has an organised technique as he got onto his toes to tap that delivery

free-flowing drive that should give him so much confidence. Half-volley outside off, he leans forward, and caresses that past extra cover. A better effort from the fielder could have kept it down to just two
cuts and misses. Asking to be hit but Nair tried to smash the cover off the ball
floats it full as the ball shapes away from outside off, Rahul lets that go
lunges forward, defends to cover
hops back to punch, but mistimes it to cover as the ball keeps a touch low
length ball angling into middle and leg, tucked to fine leg
hurries him with a skidder outside off, Nair punches it to cover
nearly had him there, beauty! This one squares Nair up as he hops back to defend. Didn't miss the edge by much. The angle from wide of the crease created a doubt in Nair's mind
driven to wide mid-on for a quick single, Rahul called 'yes' almost immediately after hitting it, and Nair responded
he tries to work it to the on side again off the backfoot, but the ball bounces a little more than he anticipated and lobs to the off side off the side of the blade
gets on top of the bounce and pats it to the off side with gentle hands
solidly behind the line of the ball as he pushes it back to the bowler
angles it full on middle stump from wide of the crease, eased back to the bowler with a straight bat
gets a thick inside edge to that firm push, straight to midwicket
cleverly done, Rahul drops it with soft hands towards the man running in from cover, scoots across for the single
lets the length ball angling in from outside off through to the wicketkeeper

tame dismissal, and Nair has had a forgettable ODI debut. Tennis ball bounce on that one, there was a hint of grip on that as well, so Nair couldn't really generate the power he would have liked on the cut shot. Looked like he wanted to pull out of the stroke at the last moment, but it was too late as the ball went off the toe end of the bat to Raza at short cover. There's the early breakthrough Zimbabwe wanted.
good line, excellent length. Just there around the off stump, Rayudu watches it through to the keeper
angles a full ball on middle, Rayudu defends and looks for the run, but Rahul wasn't interested
invites Rayudu to drive, but he lets that go instead
hint of away movement as the full ball is safely defended with bat and pad close to the body
the length ball on off skid on, Rahul gets a bit of inside edge that rolls off the pad to the off side
eased past extra cover, foot to the pitch of the ball as he made contact. Good to watch when he plays that way, a bit like M Vijay. Classical mould
squeezed to mid-off, Rayudu was hanging back but it was bowled a lot fuller. Couldn't generate power as there wasn't much back swing on that one
gets half-forward and defends
bunts a full delivery to point with an opened face of the bat
call of yes from Rahul, shouts of no from Rayudu. Cover fielder swooped in quickly

shot of the innings! The ball flew off the bat with tremendous power. Short, he rocked back and cracked it front of square over cover. The difference between Nair's dismissal and this stroke was the intent.
floats it full from wide of the crease, Rahul gets forward and across a touch and defends it back down the pitch
check-drives a full ball to extra cover. The good thing is he was up to the pitch of the ball again. Rahul's feet moving well. There has been no uncertainty so far
gets onto the backfoot and nudges it to short midwicket, Rayudu immediately signalled that he wasn't interested in the single
pushed to mid-on for a sharp single, unnecessary but Rahul was well in. He was a couple of paces outside the crease when he made contact, that perhaps gave him the confidence to complete the run
beaten on the drive. That is a delivery any fast bowler will be proud of. There was an open invitation to drive, but Rahul's feet were nowhere to the pitch of the ball as he swung through the line.
plays for the outswing, but the ball nips back in to take the edge and roll towards point
gets forward and pushes that firmly to cover
crunching extra cover drive. That was too full, Rahul planted his foot forward this time as he drilled it between cover and mid-off. He lent into it and let the timing take over.
punched wide of extra cover for a comfortable single
gets it wrong this time, but lucky to get away. Umpire Russell Tiffin doesn't think that short ball was toeing the wide line
saved by a thick inside edge. Rahul looked to drive, but the ball nipped back in late. Chatara went up in an optimistic appeal, but he knew there was a big edge, and withdrew as quickly as he went up
works it wide of midwicket for a quick single
back of length delivery outside off, gets some lift off the deck, Rayudu shoulders arms
beautiful! He isn't the most elegant when he drives, but they're mighty effective. Leans forward and steers it into the gap between the two cover fielders
shows the full face of the bat and taps it back down the pitch. Did well to cover the swing
full length delivery outside off, he lets it go
play and a miss. Wasn't all that short to flay that through point, Rahul chased that one and ended being beaten by the late away movement
delicate dab towards the man running in from point for a quick single
stretches forward and plays a copy book frontfoot defense
tapped to the off side for a quick single again
plants his foot forward and defends solidly to cover
once again, tight in defense
sharp turn away from outside off, Rayudu lets it go
punched across the line towards long-on
lunges forward and eases it with the spin to long-off
gets back and nurdles it with soft hands
pushes outside the line of that flighted ball, rolls off the inside edge to the leg side
drawn forward by the flight, he eases it to the man running in from cover for a quick single
angles a full ball onto middle, Rayudu was looking to work it past midwicket, but quickly had to make a late adjustment and defend it back down the pitch instead
that's the best ball that hasn't fetched a wicket today. Short of length on off stump, the ball lifts off the deck and nips away late to square Rayudu up, boy, perilously close to the edge

carbon copy of the previous delivery. The ball shapes away ever-so-late from off stump, Rayudu went half-forward but was squared up as the ball held its line. Jaffa, as they call it, if ever there was one
this time he's a lot more authoritative, commits to a forward defense and executes it well
play and a miss. Beaten for the third time in this over. This one was an away swinger, the angle caused a few doubts, but in all fairness, Rayudu erred by playing inside the line of the ball
gets half-forward and defends
reaches out to steer that to deep point for an easy single
rocks back to free up the off side, but was cramped for room, pushed to a square short third man
drifting into middle, worked past midwicket
picks the gap as he cuts it towards deep cover, Rayudu wasn't keep on the second
lunges forward and eases it with the spin to sweeper cover
too full on that occasion, turned to long-on
floats a full ball on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
lovely flick shot, midwicket fielder dived over the ball. A touch risky but Rahul was authoritative
solidly defended off the backfoot again. This one skid on after pitching at length on off stump
gets a thin inside edge that flies past leg stump. Lucky, he pushed outside the line of the ball
floats a length ball outside off, left alone
cuts, but hits it straight to the cover fielder
starts off with a full delivery on middle, eased back down the pitch
that is a freebie, a low full toss outside off, but no damage done as there's a sweeper cover in place for the drive
arches back and then plays the upper cut over the infield, third man comes around to cut that off
flicked, but straight to midwicket. Friendly pace this from Chigumbura, little over 115 kph
shapes to cut but this was too close to the body to play the shot, somehow managed to chop that to the off side
yorker-length delivery on off stump, Rahul looks to squeeze with an open face of the bat but the ball takes the inside-edge and nearly rolls back onto the stumps
poor bowling, sprays that down leg. Rayudu needed a faint tickle on that to get a boundary, but couldn't
firm drive, but straight to cover point
opens the face of the bat and eases it to point
gets forward and bunts it back to the bowler
wanted to pull, but changed his mind and looked to defend instead, but was squared up by the late movement
gets back and across to play that one, ball deflects off the thigh pad to short fine leg
full and swinging away from outside off, Rahul plants forward and pats it gently
loose ball, and punished. Can't bowl there at any time of the day or night. Enough width for Rayudu to free his arms and crack that into the point boundary. Pinch yourself if you don't believe me
good comeback, floats this one fuller on middle from wide of the crease, Rayudu gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg
full and inviting Rahul to play the square drive, which he did. Found the sweeper in the deep
sensible, dabs it towards short cover for a quick single. Made eye contact with Rahul and they were off
a misfield at midwicket gives them the single. Masakadza the culprit there
half-forward defence to that incoming length ball on middle.
steady back of length delivery on off stump, bunted behind the wicket on the off side
worked down to fine leg
in the slot to drive, but Rayudu can only play that as far as the cover fielder
nips back into middle, Rayudu is behind the line of the ball as he defends
opens the face of the bat at the last moment and steers it down to third man
floats a short ball on leg stump, worked behind square
nips back in to quell Rahul's intent to cut, somehow manages to get some bat on it in the end
angles it too full and down the leg side, Rahul wanted to flickk alright, but couldn't have done much about that.
this one's well outside off, overcompensates. That was around the seventh stump
uppish, but a welcome boundary. Rahul did well to go through with the shot. It was short, and he threw himself into the cut shot. Got the elevation and power
inconsistent with his line, this one slides down leg, Rahul tickles it down to fine leg, the fielder there was caught napping, a second's indecision gave away the second
yorker-length delivery on middle, squeezed to point
lovely drive on the up, lent forward and eased that into the gap at deep extra cover,  Chatara does well to slide across to his left to stop that

buffet ball, this time Chatara can't do much. Too full and inviting him to play the drive, Rayudu hammers that into the deep cover region, where the fielder dives over the ball. He did well to get to the ball but couldn't quite complete the formalities. The ball kept sliding away from him
dab gently to the wide slip fielder
drops it to the off side and scoots through for a single. There was a direct hit at the bowler's end, but Rahul, at no point, hesitated. Good work by Sibanda
nips back in as Rayudu defends that one on middle to the leg side
play and a miss. Half-forward as he looks to bunt it behind point
once again brings out the drive, but can only hit it straight to mid-off
nicely behind the length ball as he defends
uppish, but lucky that it flew wide of the point fielder. Wasn't all that short, but Rahul went through with the cut, but it kept swirling away from Sibanda
poor shot, but he's lucky again. This one was flat-batted, the ball rushed onto him to quell the pull, and he nearly lobbed it straight to mid-off. Cremer had to leap, but it just eluded him
delightful timing! Too full and Rayudu hits it straight as a dye. He generated tremendous power off the bottom hand as he made contact. Drilled with a straight bat. There's some intent for you
gets forward and plays it back to the bowler
superb straight drive, but mid-on fielder comes across to stop that
the half-stop by Sibanda at point saves three runs. It was struck well
bowls a lovely away swinger that was almost asking to be left, Rayudu does just that

cuts, and cuts really well. This one pinged the middle of his bat. Ervine covered a lot of ground from third man to deep point, an awkward slide but he still managed to pull the ball back in. Poor running, they could have easily pushed for the third. Rayudu, for a moment, stood there admiring the stroke

shimmies down the pitch, coverts it into a half-volley and clobbers that inside-out of cover. Gets the power and elevaion. Mid-off was inside the ring, so there was no risk involved with that stroke if he hit it well
nicely behind the line of the ball as he defends it back down the pitch
watches the length ball floated outside off through to the keeper
flicked with the angle, but straight to midwicket
drops it short outside off, Rahul goes onto the backfoot, makes a bit of room and cuts it really late to hit it behind point. Picks the gap to perfection
Rayudu's effervescence is rubbing off on Rahul. This one was tossed up nicely, and he got to the pitch of the ball to slap it over cover, one bounce into the ropes
reads the googly off the hand and works it between deep midwicket and long-on, back for the second comfortably
chops it wide of point to bring up a half-century on ODI debut
eased wide of point
skids onto him from off stump, bunted to the off side
floats a full ball outside off from wide of the crease, Rayudu lets it go
shoulders arms to a length ball that nips away from outside off
short of length delivery on off stump, hat-trick of leaves
incoming delivery on middle stump, played back down the pitch
this one keeps a touch low as Rayudu can't force it behind point
steady bowling this, another full-length delivery in and around the off stump, Rayudu watches it through to the keeper
drilled that, but an excellent stop at extra cover
taps it with soft hands to the off side for a quick single
drifting into middle, he lunges forward and smothers the spin
eased with the spin to cover
too full on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
fetches the flick from outside off, eased to long-on
stands tall and forces it off the backfoot to deep cover
short, wide and cut to deep point
hangs back and chops the short ball to point
Laxman-like flick, but straight to Raza at midwicket
opens the face of the bat late and runs it down to third man
pleasing drive to sweeper cover
not much spin, this skids on from middle, worked to long-on
flicked across the line to deep midwicket
reaches out and eases that to sweeper cover
quicker through the air, too full on off stump, he gets forward and bunts it to the off side
drifting into middle, worked wide of midwicket
wrong'un which he picks early and works it with the spin to long-on, sensible stuff
rip roaring bouncer outside off, Rahul initially shaped to pull but swayed out of the way late
stands tall and whips it off his hip to midwicket, Rayudu was briefly outside his crease, Raza fires a throw, no damage done as he misses. Rayudu had to dive full-length forward to get back too
stands tall and punches it back to the bowler
into the drive, the slower ball nearly consumes him as it lobs in the air, but just short of Cremer at mid-off
there was a lot of punch in that drive, straight to mid-off
cuts and he finds the gap between the two point fielder, third man comes around to cut that off
gets forward and gently defends
stretches forward to pat that one to the off side
worked wide of midwicket for an easy single
gets back and punches it to deep midwicket
there's a hint of drift and turn from middle, Rayudu has to make a late adjustment to cover the spin and defend
steps out and works it across the line to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle from round the stumps, turned back to the bowler
lobbed up on off stump, he stretches forward and defends
rocks back and pulls it to deep midwicket
on the shorter side again, this time the pull is played to the right of the man at deep midwicket
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it to wide long-off
driven past extra cover an easy single
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it inside-out to sweeper cover
firm drive to long-off, they're just milking the bowling here
on the pads, worked with the angle to deep midwicket
wrong'un this time, Rayudu, who shaped to cut initially, quickly made the late adjustment to transfer his weight onto the backfoot and pull that into the gap at deep square leg. Excellent timing too
eased with the spin to short third man
gets a good stride forward and smothers the spin
this one's given a good rip, Rahul hangs back and defends it
driven to cover
too short, and punished. He's crunched the pull into the gap at deep midwicket. The ball kept a touch low, but he still generated enough power on the stroke
whipped to deep midwicket
makes a bit of room to open up the off side, and thwacks it straight to point
wants to pull but the ball slides across the batsman to beat the outside edge
gets forward and defends
steps out and works it across the line to deep midwicket
stretches forward and bunts it back to the bowler
turned to midwicket as they amble across
flipper on middle, Rahul defends it back to the bowler
called for two as soon as he cut that into the gap at deep point, fielder had to run around the ropes to stop that
flatter one on middle, worked to deep midwicket,  there's a measured half-century too
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it to long-off
steps out to drive, ends up squeezing it to short third man
bowls legspin this time, Rayudu makes room and cuts it to cover
play and a miss. This one skids across to beat the outside edge
works it with the spin to midwicket
punched past the bowler to long-off
steps out and eases it inside-out to deep cover
gets an edge to short third man. Closed the bat face a touch as he looked to work it wide of midwicket
driven with the spin to long-off, hint of grip on that occasion, Rahul had to check his shot
flatter one on middle and leg, punched to long-on. Rayudu has mellowed down after the sudden spurt of aggression.
makes room and bunts it to cover
gets onto the backfoot and wrists it to deep square leg
tossed up on off stump, eased off the frontfoot to cover
leggie from Raza, punched to cover
swept with the spin to short fine leg
punched past the bowler to long-off
slapped past the bowler. It was short, and he unleashed the cross-court forehand like stroke past mid-off. Once it beat the infield, there was no stopping thta
gets forward and plays it back to the bowler
steps out to ease it past cover, but jabs the ball with hard hands instead
rocks back and dabs it to the off side
pushed to wide long-off for an easy single
the ball pitches on off and skids on, Rahul is behind the line as he punches it back to the bowler

dear me,  a run-out chance has been missed.  Not that it would have made a difference though. Rahul works it to midwicket, Rayudu was interested in the run and was more than halfway down the pitch when he was sent back. A  direct hit at the bowler's end would have nailed him despite the dive
swept to deep square leg
quicker one on leg stump, defended back down the pitch
on the shorter side again, punched to midwicket
leans forward and eases it to wide long-off
cuts, but hits it straight to the point fielder
punched to long-off, comfortably done. Into the 80s
maybe he's trying for it after all. Too full, and he comes down hard on that as he drills it over the infield, couple of bounces into the cover boundary
driven on the up to sweeper cover, the fielder in the deep was moving gingerly to his left, enough time to steal the second
mistimes a cut to cover
whipped off his hip to deep square leg, wanted the second at one point, but realised Rayudu was a touch slow
stays inside the crease and bunts it to the off side
floats a short ball outside off, Rayudu lets it go
gives the length ball a flat-batted thwack, but straight to mid-off
shapes to cut but ends up slicing the ball uppishly to third man, wasn't interested in the single initially, but went threough in the end
a misfield at cover gives them a single, Rahul back on strike again
punched past the bowler, mid-on runs across to where mid-off is generally stationed to cut that off, excellent anticipation
once again he looks to make room and go over point, but is cramped and ends up hitting the short ball to mid-off
too full on middle, he gets an inside edge to short midwicket
shapes away off the seam, keeper is up and Rayudu pulls out of an attempted dab down to third man
this time he's successful at the delicate dab to third man
hops back and across as he whips it to deep square leg
gets a good stride forward and eases it back past the bowler for an easy single
eased past extra cover for an easy single
gets half-forward and jabs the ball to the off side
he's hit on the thigh as the ball nips back in sharply to beat the bat. There was a stifled appeal, but Chibhabha knew the ball was sliding down leg
punched down the ground to long-on
floats a length ball on middle stump, Rayudu gets across and offers a straight bat to that
rides the bounce and eases it down to third man
short ball on middle, Rahul winds up to play a flat-batted pull but doesn't get the elevation, one bounce to long-on, a run is all he'll get
gets forward and defends again
slides a length ball on middle, Rahul wrists it to square leg, wanted the run but quickly decided against it
on the pads, flicked to fine leg, took on the fielder in the deep and managed to scoot back in

take that, thanks for coming! KL Rahul, take a bow. He was waiting for this, or so it seemed. This one was too full and right in the slot for him to swing across the line, and he got enough bat on it as the ball sailed over the stands at long-on.  That's a century on ODI debut!  Rahul lets out a roar. He's only the 11th debutant to make a century on ODI debut, he's the first Indian. Rayudu has played his part in the century too by giving him enough strike towards the end. Chants of 'Raaahul Raaahul' echo across the Harare Sports Club.
